Great. What about the hotel? Is it close to the convention center?
Yes, it's only a five-minute walk. I've reserved two single rooms.

Most of them are confirmed. I'll email you the updated itinerary this afternoon.
Thank you. Don't forget to pack some formal clothes for the dinner gala.
I've already got my suit ready. I think we're all set.

Could you please give me back my book tomorrow?
The plane took off exactly on schedule.
Can you look after my plants while I'm on vacation?

He usually goes to the gym before work.
The cat jumped across the narrow stream.

title: Phrasal Verbs (Mental: Think over / Figure out / etc.)
notes:
တွေးတောကြံဆမှုနဲ့ဆိုင်တဲ့ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို လေ့လာပါမယ်။

- Think over: သေသေချာချာ စဉ်းစားသည်
- Figure out: အဖြေရှာသည် / နားလည်အောင်လုပ်သည်
- Make up: ဖန်တီးသည် (ဥပမာ - make up a story)
- Work out: အဆင်ပြေသွားသည် / တွက်ချက်သည်

examples.en: I need some time to think over your proposal.
examples.my: မင်းရဲ့ အဆိုပြုချက်ကို သေသေချာချာ စဉ်းစားဖို့ ကျွန်တော့်မှာ အချိန်လိုအပ်ပါတယ်။

examples.en: I finally figured out how to use the software.
Don't believe him; he made up the whole story.
examples.my: သူ့ကို မယုံနဲ့၊ သူက ဇာတ်လမ်းတစ်ပုဒ်လုံးကို လုပ်ကြံဖန်တီးထားတာ။

lines.text: Hi, I'm Adrian, your personal trainer for today.
Hi Adrian. I'm looking to build some muscle and improve my endurance.
Great goals. Let's start with a warm-up on the rowing machine.
Okay. How long should I do this for?
About ten minutes. Then we'll move on to some weightlifting exercises.
I've never lifted weights before. Is it dangerous?
Not if you have proper form. I'll show you exactly what to do.
That sounds good. I want to make sure I'm doing it correctly.

title: Phrasal Verbs (Social: Go out / Hang out / etc.)
notes:
လူမှုဆက်ဆံရေးမှာ သုံးတဲ့ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို လေ့လာပါမယ်။

- Go out: (ပျော်ပွဲရွှင်ပွဲအတွက်) အပြင်ထွက်သည်
- Hang out: (အပျော်သဘော) အချိန်ဖြုန်းသည် / စုဝေးသည်
- Get along: အဆင်ပြေပြေ ပေါင်းသင်းသည်
- Show up: ရောက်ရှိလာသည် / ကိုယ်ထင်ပြသည်

examples.en: Do you want to go out for dinner tonight?
examples.my: ဒီည ညစာအပြင်ထွက်စားဖို့ မင်း ဆန္ဒရှိသလား။

examples.en: I love hanging out with my friends on weekends.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော် သူငယ်ချင်းတွေနဲ့အတူ ပိတ်ရက်တွေမှာ အချိန်ဖြုန်းရတာ ကြိုက်တယ်။

examples.en: She gets along very well with her new neighbors.
examples.my: သူမဟာ အိမ်နီးချင်းအသစ်တွေနဲ့ အရမ်းအဆင်ပြေပါတယ်။

lines.text: What kind of music do you like to listen to?
I really enjoy alternative rock and some indie pop.
That's cool. Do you play any musical instruments?
I've been playing the acoustic guitar for about five years now.
Wow, that's impressive. Do you ever perform in public?
Only at small open mic nights. It's quite nerve-wracking!
I can imagine. I'd love to hear you play sometime.
Maybe next time you come over, I can play a song for you.

title: Phrasal Verbs (Work: Hand in / Call off / etc.)
notes:
အလုပ်ခွင်မှာ သုံးတဲ့ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို လေ့လာပါမယ်။

- Hand in: (အလုပ်၊ အစီရင်ခံစာ) တင်ပြသည်
- Call off: ဖျက်သိမ်းသည် (ဥပမာ - call off a meeting)
- Put off: ရွှေ့ဆိုင်းသည် (ဥပမာ - put off a task)
- Take over: လွှဲပြောင်းရယူသည်

examples.en: Please hand in your reports by the end of the day.
examples.my: ဒီနေ့ အလုပ်ဆင်းချိန်မှာ အစီရင်ခံစာတွေကို တင်ပြပေးပါ။

examples.en: The meeting was called off due to the bad weather.
examples.my: ရာသီဥတုဆိုးရွားမှုကြောင့် အစည်းအဝေးကို ဖျက်သိမ်းလိုက်ရတယ်။

examples.en: Don't put off until tomorrow what you can do today.
examples.my: ဒီနေ့ လုပ်နိုင်တဲ့အလုပ်ကို မနက်ဖြန်အထိ မရွှေ့ဆိုင်းပါနဲ့။

quiz.q: The match was ___ (call) because of rain.
Can you ___ (take) the project while I'm away?

title: In a Job Interview (Strengths and Weaknesses)

lines.text: What would you say is your greatest strength?
I think my greatest strength is my ability to stay calm under pressure.
That's a very valuable trait. And what about your weaknesses?
Sometimes I focus too much on details, which can slow me down.
How do you try to overcome that?
I set strict deadlines for myself and try to keep the bigger picture in mind.
I see. It's good that you're self-aware and working on it.
Yes, I'm always looking for ways to improve my efficiency.

title: Phrasal Verbs (Clothing: Try on / Dress up / etc.)
notes:
အဝတ်အစားနဲ့ဆိုင်တဲ့ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို လေ့လာပါမယ်။

- Try on: စမ်းဝတ်ကြည့်သည်
- Dress up: သပ်သပ်ရပ်ရပ် ဝတ်ဆင်သည်
- Put on: ဝတ်ဆင်သည်
- Take off: ချွတ်သည်

examples.en: You should try on the dress before you buy it.
examples.my: အင်္ကျီမဝယ်ခင် စမ်းဝတ်ကြည့်သင့်တယ်။

examples.en: We're going to a fancy restaurant, so we need to dress up.
examples.my: ငါတို့ ဟိုတယ်ကြီးကို သွားမှာဆိုတော့ သေသေသပ်သပ် ဝတ်ဖို့လိုတယ်။

examples.en: Take off your coat and stay a while.
examples.my: မင်းရဲ့ ကုတ်အင်္ကျီကို ချွတ်လိုက်ပါဦး။

quiz.q: It's time to ___ (dress) for the party.

lines.text: Hi, I'd like to get this suit tailored, please. It's a bit too loose.
No problem. Let's take your measurements first.
I also want to shorten the trousers by about an inch.
Okay. And how about the jacket sleeves? They seem a bit long.
Yes, please shorten them as well.
Got it. When would you like to pick it up?
Is next Friday possible?
Yes, that should be fine. It will be ready by 4 PM.

title: Phrasal Verbs (Health: Pass out / Get over / etc.)
notes:
ကျန်းမာရေးနဲ့ဆိုင်တဲ့ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို လေ့လာပါမယ်။

- Pass out: သတိလစ်သွားသည်
- Get over: (ဖျားနာမှုမှ) ပြန်လည်သက်သာလာသည်
- Come down with: (ရောဂါ) ကူးစက်ခံရသည် / ဖျားသည်
- Work out: ကိုယ်လက်လှုပ်ရှား လေ့ကျင့်ခန်းလုပ်သည်

examples.en: It was so hot in the room that he passed out.
examples.my: အခန်းထဲမှာ အရမ်းပူလို့ သူ သတိလစ်သွားခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: It took her a week to get over the flu.
examples.my: သူမ တုပ်ကွေးပျောက်ဖို့ တစ်ပတ်လောက် ကြာခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: I think I'm coming down with a cold.
examples.my: ငါ အအေးမိတော့မယ် ထင်တယ်။

lines.text: What do you think will be the most significant technological change in the next 20 years?
I think self-driving cars and advanced AI will become part of our daily lives.
That's quite possible. How about space travel for ordinary people?
It might happen, but it will probably be very expensive at first.
I hope we find ways to produce clean energy more efficiently too.
Me too. That would be a huge step towards protecting the environment.
The future seems both exciting and a bit uncertain, doesn't it?
It definitely does. But I'm optimistic about what we can achieve.

title: Progress Exam 14
explanation: ယခင်သင်ခန်းစာများမှ သဒ္ဒါနှင့် စကားပြောများကို ပြန်လည်စစ်ဆေးခြင်း။

lines.text: I need to think over your offer before I decide.
I'll help you figure out how to solve this problem.
They love hanging out at the local coffee shop.
Please hand in your application by the end of the week.
The meeting was put off until next Monday.
You should try on the shirt to see if it fits.
He is slowly getting over his bad cold.
I think I'm coming down with something; I feel quite weak.
Self-driving cars could change our lives in the future.
Congratulations on your self-awareness and hard work!

title: Passive Voice (Advanced Review)
notes:
Passive Voice ကို Continuous နဲ့ Perfect Tenses တွေမှာ ပိုမိုကျွမ်းကျင်အောင် ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

- Present Perfect: has/have been + V3
- Past Perfect: had been + V3
- Present Continuous: am/is/are + being + V3
- Past Continuous: was/were + being + V3

examples.en: The bridge is being inspected by engineers.
examples.my: တံတားကို အင်ဂျင်နီယာတွေက စစ်ဆေးနေကြတယ်။

examples.en: The decision had been made before I arrived.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော်မရောက်ခင် ဆုံးဖြတ်ချက်က ချခဲ့ပြီးသားပါ။

examples.en: Has the problem been solved yet?

lines.text: Hi, I'm interested in the SUV advertised on your website.
Yes, the 2022 model. It's in excellent condition. Would you like to take it for a test drive?
I would. How many miles has it done?
It has about 15,000 miles on the clock. It was mainly used for city driving.
Does it come with a full service history?
Yes, we have all the records right here. It's been very well maintained.
What's your best price for it?
We're asking $28,000, but I could offer you a small discount for a quick sale.

title: Conditionals (Advanced Review)
notes: Conditionals (If-clauses) တွေကို အခြေအနေအမျိုးမျိုးမှာ မှန်မှန်ကန်ကန် သုံးနိုင်ဖို့ ပြန်လည်လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။ ရောနှောနေတဲ့ (Mixed Conditionals) တွေကိုလည်း သတိပြုပါ။

examples.en: If I had more money, I would buy that car. (2nd)
examples.my: ငါ့မှာ ပိုက်ဆံပိုရှိရင် အဲဒီကားကို ဝယ်မှာ။

examples.en: If she had studied, she would have passed. (3rd)
examples.my: သူမသာ စာလုပ်ခဲ့ရင် အောင်မှာပဲ။

examples.en: If I had taken your advice, I would be happy now. (Mixed)
examples.my: မင်းရဲ့ အကြံဉာဏ်ကို ငါသာ ယူခဲ့ရင် အခု ငါပျော်နေမှာ။

quiz.q: If I ___ (be) you, I wouldn't do that.
If they ___ (arrive) earlier, they wouldn't have missed the flight.

lines.text: What do you think is the biggest threat to our environment today?
I think climate change and the loss of biodiversity are the most critical issues.
Do you think we're doing enough to combat these problems?
Unfortunately, no. We need more radical changes in how we produce and consume energy.
What can individuals do to help?
Reducing our carbon footprint, supporting sustainable products, and advocating for policy changes are all important.
It's a huge challenge, but we have to start somewhere.
Exactly. Every action counts, no matter how small it may seem.

title: Reported Speech (Comprehensive Review)
notes:
Reported Speech မှာ အချိန်နဲ့ နေရာပြ စကားလုံးတွေရဲ့ အပြောင်းအလဲကို အထူးသတိပြုပါ။

- Now -> Then / Today -> That day
- Tomorrow -> The next day / Yesterday -> The day before
- Here -> There / This -> That

examples.en: He said, "I'm busy today."
examples.my: သူက "ငါ ဒီနေ့ အလုပ်ရှုပ်နေတယ်" လို့ ပြောတယ်။

examples.en: He said he was busy that day.
examples.my: သူ အဲဒီနေ့မှာ အလုပ်ရှုပ်နေတယ်လို့ ပြောခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: She told me she would call me the next day.
examples.my: သူမ နောက်နေ့မှာ ကျွန်တော့်ဆီ ဖုန်းဆက်မယ်လို့ ပြောခဲ့တယ်။

quiz.q:
Direct: "I'll be here tomorrow."
Reported: She said she ___ there the next day.

Direct: "I saw him yesterday."
Reported: He said he ___ him the day before.

lines.text: Hello, I'm looking for a small office space for my startup company.
We have several options available. What size and location are you looking for?
Something around 500 square feet, preferably in the downtown area.
I have just the place! It's on the third floor of a modern building with great facilities.
What's the monthly rent and does it include high-speed internet?
The rent is $1,500 per month, and yes, high-speed fiber internet is included.
Are there any meeting rooms we can use?
Yes, there are shared meeting rooms on every floor that you can book in advance.

title: Modal Verbs of Deduction (Review)
notes:
ဖြစ်နိုင်ခြေကို ခန့်မှန်းတဲ့ Modal Verbs တွေကို Present နဲ့ Past နှစ်မျိုးလုံးမှာ ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

- Present: must / might / can't + Verb 1
- Past: must / might / can't + have + Verb 3

examples.en: He must be at home. His car is in the driveway.
examples.my: သူ အိမ်မှာ ရှိနေမှာ သေချာတယ်။ သူ့ကားက လမ်းဘေးမှာ ရှိနေလို့ပါ။

examples.en: She can't have forgotten. I reminded her this morning.
examples.my: သူမ မေ့သွားတာ မဖြစ်နိုင်ဘူး။ ဒီမနက်တင် ကျွန်တော် သူမကို သတိပေးခဲ့တာပါ။

examples.en: They might have missed the train.
examples.my: သူတို့ ရထား လွတ်သွားတာ ဖြစ်နိုင်ပါတယ်။

quiz.q: He ___ (lost) his way. He's very late.

lines.text: Hi, I'm having trouble with my laptop. It keeps crashing when I open certain apps.
I see. Have you tried restarting it or checking for updates?
Yes, I've done both, but the problem persists.
Let me run a diagnostic test to see if there are any hardware issues.
How long will that take? I have an important meeting in an hour.
It should only take about 15 minutes. Please have a seat.
(After 15 mins) Okay, it looks like a software conflict. I'll need to reinstall the OS.
Can you make sure all my files are backed up first?

title: Gerunds vs Infinitives (Review)
notes: ကြိယာတစ်ခုနောက်မှာ နောက်ထပ် ကြိယာတစ်ခု လိုက်တဲ့အခါ Gerund (V-ing) သို့မဟုတ် Infinitive (to + V1) ကို ဘယ်လိုခွဲခြားသုံးမလဲဆိုတာ ပြန်လည်လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: I enjoy reading before I go to sleep.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော် အိပ်မသွားခင် စာဖတ်ရတာကို နှစ်သက်ပါတယ်။

examples.en: He promised to call me as soon as he arrives.
examples.my: သူ ရောက်ရောက်ချင်း ကျွန်တော့်ကို ဖုန်းဆက်ဖို့ သူ ကတိပေးခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: Don't forget to lock the door.

quiz.q: She decided ___ (not / buy) the expensive dress.

lines.text: We need to start planning our annual charity fundraiser for the local animal shelter.
Great! What kind of event should we have this year? An auction or a gala dinner?
I was thinking of a community fun run. It's more inclusive and healthy.
That's a brilliant idea! We can have different categories for all ages.
Exactly. We'll need to find sponsors and get permission from the city council.
I can handle the sponsor outreach. I have some good contacts in local businesses.
Excellent. I'll work on the logistics and the registration website.
Let's meet next week to review our progress.

title: Progress Exam 15
explanation: ယခင်သင်ခန်းစာများမှ သဒ္ဒါနှင့် စကားပြောများကို ပြန်လည်စစ်ဆေးခြင်း။

lines.text: The bridge is being repaired by a team of construction workers.
If I had taken your advice, I wouldn't be in this situation now.
She said that she had already finished the project.
You must have left your umbrella at the restaurant.
I decided not to buy the new smartphone yet.
The office space is located in the heart of downtown.
Have you ever considered volunteering at an animal shelter?
We should start using more sustainable products in our daily lives.
He asked me if I would be available for a meeting tomorrow.
Congratulations on the successful completion of your startup!

title: Articles (Review and Special Cases)
notes: Articles (A, An, The) တွေကို အသုံးအနှုန်း ပိုမိုစုံလင်စွာ ပြန်လည်လေ့လာပါမယ်။ အထူးသဖြင့် တိုင်းပြည်အမည်များ၊ အားကစားများနှင့် တူရိယာများရှေ့မှာ သုံးနှုန်းပုံကို သတိပြုပါ။

examples.en: He plays the guitar, but he doesn't play football.
examples.my: သူက ဂစ်တာတီးတတ်ပေမယ့် ဘောလုံးတော့ မကစားဘူး။

examples.en: I'm from Myanmar, but I've lived in the United States.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော်က မြန်မာနိုင်ငံကပါ၊ ဒါပေမယ့် အမေရိကန်မှာ နေခဲ့ဖူးတယ်။

examples.en: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day.
examples.my: မနက်စာဟာ တစ်နေ့တာရဲ့ အရေးကြီးဆုံး အစားအစာ ဖြစ်ပါတယ်။

quiz.q: I'm going to ___ Philippines next month.

lines.text: What's the most important national holiday in your country?
I think it's Independence Day. We celebrate it with parades and traditional music.
That sounds interesting. How do people usually celebrate at home?
Most families get together for a big meal and spend time with each other.
Is it a public holiday for everyone?
Yes, almost all businesses and schools are closed for the day.
I'd love to experience it someday. It sounds like a lot of fun.
You should definitely visit! You'd be very welcome.

title: Countable vs Uncountable (Advanced Review)
notes:
ရေတွက်လို့ရတဲ့နာမ်နဲ့ မရတဲ့နာမ်တွေမှာ အရေအတွက်ပြ စကားလုံးတွေကို ဘယ်လိုတွဲသုံးရမလဲဆိုတာ ပြန်လည်လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။

- Countable: a few, many, several
- Uncountable: a little, much, a great deal of
- Both: some, any, a lot of

examples.en: I only have a little information about the trip.
examples.my: ခရီးစဉ်အကြောင်း ကျွန်တော့်မှာ အချက်အလက် အနည်းငယ်ပဲ ရှိပါတယ်။

examples.en: She has many friends in this city.
examples.my: သူမမှာ ဒီမြို့ထဲမှာ သူငယ်ချင်းတွေ အများကြီးရှိတယ်။

examples.en: Do we have enough money for the taxi?
examples.my: ငါတို့ဆီမှာ တက္ကစီခအတွက် ပိုက်ဆံ လုံလုံလောက်လောက် ရှိလား။

quiz.q: There are ___ (few) apples in the fridge.
I need ___ (some) help with my homework.

title: In a Clothing Store (Returns and Exchanges)

lines.text: Hi, I'd like to return this shirt, please. It's a bit too small for me.
Do you have the receipt and are the tags still on it?
Yes, I have them right here.
Okay. Would you like a refund or would you prefer to exchange it for a larger size?
I'd like to exchange it if you have it in a large.
Let me check... Yes, we have one more in stock. Here you go.
Thank you so much. Can I try it on to be sure?
Of course. The fitting rooms are just over there.

title: Reported Speech (Mixed Review)
notes: Reported Speech မှာ Statements နဲ့ Questions တွေကို ရောနှောပြီး ပြန်လည်လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: He said he was learning English.
examples.my: သူ အင်္ဂလိပ်စာ သင်ယူနေတယ်လို့ ပြောခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: She asked me if I had seen her keys.
examples.my: သူမရဲ့ သော့တွေကို ကျွန်တော် မြင်မိသလားလို့ သူမက မေးခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: They told us not to be late for the meeting.

lines.text: We finally moved into our new apartment! We should have a housewarming party.
That's a great idea! When were you thinking of having it?
Maybe next Saturday afternoon. A casual get-together.
I can help you with the food. We could make some easy finger foods.
Perfect. And I'll handle the drinks and the decorations.
How many people are you planning to invite?
About 15-20 close friends and some of our new neighbors.
It's going to be a fun afternoon. I can't wait to see your new place!

title: Phrasal Verbs (Review - Social and Mental)
notes:
လူမှုဆက်ဆံရေးနဲ့ တွေးတောကြံဆမှုဆိုင်ရာ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

- Hang out, get along, go out
- Think over, figure out, make up

examples.en: We should hang out sometime.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော်တို့ တစ်ချိန်ချိန်မှာ အတူတူ အချိန်ဖြုန်းကြရအောင်။

examples.en: I need to think over your offer.
examples.my: မင်းရဲ့ ကမ်းလှမ်းချက်ကို ကျွန်တော် သေသေချာချာ စဉ်းစားဖို့ လိုပါတယ်။

examples.en: Do you get along with your colleagues?
examples.my: မင်းရဲ့ လုပ်ဖော်ကိုင်ဖက်တွေနဲ့ အဆင်ပြေရဲ့လား။

quiz.q: I finally ___ (figure) how to solve the puzzle.

lines.text: Welcome back! How was your trip to Vietnam?
It was amazing! We visited Hanoi and Ha Long Bay.
I've always wanted to go to Ha Long Bay. Was it as beautiful as the photos?
Even more so. The scenery was absolutely breathtaking.
And how about the food? I've heard Vietnamese food is delicious.
It really is. We had some incredible pho and fresh spring rolls.
I'm so jealous! I'll have to plan a trip there soon.
You definitely should. You won't regret it.

title: Conditionals (Mixed Review)
notes: Conditionals (If-clauses) တွေကို အခြေအနေအမျိုးမျိုးမှာ မှန်မှန်ကန်ကန် သုံးနိုင်ဖို့ ပြန်လည်လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: If I have time, I'll help you. (1st)
examples.my: ငါ အချိန်ရရင် မင်းကို ကူညီမယ်။

examples.en: If I were rich, I'd travel the world. (2nd)
examples.my: ငါသာ ချမ်းသာရင် ကမ္ဘာပတ်မှာ။

examples.en: If I had seen her, I would have said hi. (3rd)
examples.my: ငါသာ သူမကို မြင်ခဲ့ရင် နှုတ်ဆက်မိမှာ။

quiz.q: If it ___ (rain), we'll stay at home.
I ___ (buy) that house if I were you.

lines.text: I'm very happy to offer you the promotion to Senior Manager.
Thank you. I'm excited about this new opportunity.
The new position comes with a 10% increase in your base salary.
I appreciate the offer, but I was hoping for something closer to 15% given my recent performance and the increased responsibilities.
I see. Let me discuss this with the HR department and get back to you.
Thank you. I believe my contributions to the last major project justify this request.
You've definitely made a significant impact. I'll do my best to support your request.
I appreciate that. I'm really looking forward to this new chapter.

title: Progress Exam 16
explanation: ယခင်သင်ခန်းစာများမှ သဒ္ဒါနှင့် စကားပြောများကို ပြန်လည်စစ်ဆေးခြင်း။

lines.text: He plays the violin beautifully, doesn't he?
I'm from the United Kingdom, but I live in Myanmar now.
I only have a little information about the new policy.
I'd like to exchange this jacket for a larger size, please.
She said that she had already finished her lunch.
We should hang out together more often in the future.
The scenery in Ha Long Bay was absolutely breathtaking.
If I were you, I would negotiate for a higher salary.
He asked me if I would be available for a meeting next week.
Congratulations on your well-deserved promotion to Senior Manager!

title: Passive Voice (Mixed Review)
notes: Passive Voice ကို Tense အမျိုးမျိုးမှာ ရောနှောပြီး အသုံးချပုံကို ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: The room is being cleaned as we speak.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော်တို့ စကားပြောနေတုန်းမှာ အခန်းကို သန့်ရှင်းရေး လုပ်နေကြတယ်။

examples.en: The letter had been sent before I arrived.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော် မရောက်ခင်ကတည်းက စာက ပို့ပြီးသား ဖြစ်နေခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: Everything will be finished by tomorrow.
examples.my: အားလုံးကို မနက်ဖြန်မှာ အပြီးသတ်ပါလိမ့်မယ်။

quiz.q: The cake ___ (eat) by the time I got there.

lines.text: How much time do you spend on social media each day?
Too much, I'm afraid! I easily spend two or three hours scrolling through my feeds.
What do you think is the biggest impact of social media on our lives?
It keeps us connected, but it can also make us feel more isolated and increase anxiety.
I agree. Do you think we should try to limit our screen time?
Definitely. Taking regular breaks from social media can really help improve our mental well-being.
I've been trying to stay off my phone for at least an hour before bed.
That's a great habit. I should try doing that too!

title: Relative Clauses (Review with Prepositions)
notes: Relative Clauses တွေနဲ့ Prepositions (ဝိဘတ်) တွေကို ဘယ်လိုတွဲသုံးရမလဲဆိုတာ ပြန်လည်လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: The house in which I live is very old.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော် နေထိုင်တဲ့ အိမ်က အရမ်းဟောင်းနေပြီ။

examples.en: The person to whom I spoke was very helpful.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော် စကားပြောခဲ့တဲ့လူက အရမ်းကူညီတတ်ပါတယ်။

examples.en: That is the film about which everyone is talking.
examples.my: ဒါကတော့ အားလုံးပြောနေကြတဲ့ ရုပ်ရှင်ဖြစ်ပါတယ်။

quiz.q: The man ___ (who / I worked) is very experienced.
The city ___ (which / she is from) is beautiful.

lines.text: Hi, I rented this bike an hour ago, but the chain keeps falling off.
I'm very sorry about that. Let me take a look at it.
It's really frustrating. I couldn't even make it to the park.
I see the problem. The derailleur needs adjustment. I'll give you a different bike right away.
Thank you. Can I have a helmet with this one too?
Of course. And I'll add an extra hour to your rental for free to compensate for the trouble.
That's very kind of you. I appreciate it.
You're welcome! Enjoy your ride.

title: Phrasal Verbs (Health and Lifestyle)
notes:
ကျန်းမာရေးနဲ့ လူနေမှုပုံစံဆိုင်ရာ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို လေ့လာပါမယ်။

- Cut down on: (စားသောက်မှု) လျှော့ချသည်
- Give up: (အလေ့အကျင့်) စွန့်လွှတ်သည်
- Keep up with: ရင်ပေါင်တန်းနိုင်အောင်လုပ်သည်
- Work out: လေ့ကျင့်ခန်းလုပ်သည်

examples.en: I'm trying to cut down on sugar.
He decided to give up smoking.
examples.my: သူ ဆေးလိပ်သောက်တာကို ဖြတ်ဖို့ ဆုံးဖြတ်လိုက်တယ်။

examples.en: I find it hard to keep up with the new technology.
examples.my: နည်းပညာအသစ်တွေကို ရင်ပေါင်တန်းဖို့ ကျွန်တော် ခက်ခဲနေပါတယ်။

quiz.q: I ___ (work) at the gym twice a week.

lines.text: I'm interested in doing some volunteer work this weekend. Do you have any suggestions?
The local food bank is always looking for help with sorting and packing donations.
That sounds like a great cause. How can I sign up?
You can visit their website or just give them a call. They have shifts on Saturday and Sunday.
Okay, I'll check it out. Is there anything specific I should bring?
Just wear comfortable clothes and closed-toe shoes. They'll provide everything else.
Great. I'm really looking forward to giving back to the community.
That's wonderful. I'm sure they'll really appreciate your help.

title: Conditionals (Mixed Review 2)
notes: Conditionals တွေကို ပိုမိုရှုပ်ထွေးတဲ့ ဝါကျတွေမှာ ဘယ်လိုမှန်မှန်ကန်ကန် သုံးနှုန်းမလဲဆိုတာကို ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: If I had known, I would have told you.
If she were here, she would know what to do.
examples.my: သူမသာ ဒီမှာရှိရင် ဘာလုပ်ရမလဲဆိုတာ သိမှာပဲ။

examples.en: If you study hard, you will pass the exam.

quiz.q: If I ___ (be) a bird, I would fly.
If we ___ (leave) now, we will be on time.

lines.text: Do you have any questions for us before we wrap up?
Yes, I'd like to know more about the team I'll be working with.
You'll be working with a very collaborative and creative group of six people.
That sounds great. When can I expect to hear back from you regarding your decision?
We should have a decision by the end of next week.
Thank you. I appreciate the opportunity to interview for this position.
You're welcome. It was a pleasure meeting you, Sarah.
Thank you. Have a great day!

title: Wish vs Hope
notes:
'Wish' နဲ့ 'Hope' ရဲ့ ကွာခြားချက်ကို လေ့လာပါမယ်။

- Hope: ဖြစ်နိုင်ခြေရှိတဲ့ အရာတွေအတွက် သုံးပါတယ် (Future or Present possibility).
ဥပမာ - I hope you have a nice day.
- Wish: မဖြစ်နိုင်တဲ့ သို့မဟုတ် မဖြစ်ခဲ့တဲ့ အရာတွေအတွက် သုံးပါတယ် (Impossible or regretful situations).
ဥပမာ - I wish I could fly.

examples.en: I hope it doesn't rain tomorrow.
examples.my: မနက်ဖြန် မိုးမရွာဖို့ ကျွန်တော် မျှော်လင့်ပါတယ်။

examples.en: I wish I had more free time.
They hope to visit Japan next year.

quiz.q: I ___ (wish / hope) you win the competition.
She ___ (wish / hope) she hadn't said that.

lines.text: What are your main goals for the next three years?
I really want to improve my professional skills and maybe learn a new language.
That's a great ambition. Which language are you interested in?
I've always been fascinated by Japanese culture, so I'm thinking about learning Japanese.
Japanese is a beautiful language. It will definitely be a rewarding challenge.
I hope so. I also want to travel more and explore different parts of the world.
Travel is one of the best ways to learn and grow as a person.
I completely agree. I can't wait to see where the next few years take me.

title: Progress Exam 17
explanation: ယခင်သင်ခန်းစာများမှ သဒ္ဒါနှင့် စကားပြောများကို ပြန်လည်စစ်ဆေးခြင်း။

lines.text: The room had been cleaned before the guests arrived.
I'm trying to cut down on the amount of coffee I drink.
If I had known about the party, I would have come.
I hope you have a wonderful time on your vacation.
The house in which she was born is now a museum.
I wish I could speak more than one language fluently.
We're going out for dinner to celebrate my birthday.
She asked me if I would be able to help her with the project.
The derailleur on my bike needs adjustment; it's not working properly.
Congratulations on your ambitious goals for the future!

title: Passive Voice (Final Review)
notes: Passive Voice ကို Tense အမျိုးမျိုးမှာ ကျွမ်းကျင်စွာ အသုံးချနိုင်အောင် နောက်ဆုံးအကြိမ် ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။ အထူးသဖြင့် ဆောင်းပါးတွေနဲ့ သတင်းတွေမှာ သုံးနှုန်းပုံကို သတိပြုပါ။

examples.en: The building was designed by a world-renowned architect.
examples.my: ဒီအဆောက်အဦကို ကမ္ဘာကျော် ဗိသုကာပညာရှင် တစ်ယောက်က ဒီဇိုင်းထုတ်ခဲ့တာပါ။

examples.en: The suspect is being questioned by the police.
examples.my: သံသယရှိသူကို ရဲတွေက စစ်မေးနေကြတယ်။

examples.en: All the tasks will have been completed by Friday.
examples.my: အလုပ်အားလုံးကို သောကြာနေ့မှာ အပြီးသတ်ပါလိမ့်မယ်။

quiz.q: The match ___ (cancel) due to heavy rain.

lines.text: What's your absolute favorite type of cuisine?
I really love traditional Myanmar food, especially Mohinga. It's so flavorful.
Mohinga is delicious! Do you have a favorite place to eat it?
There's a small stall near my house that makes the best Mohinga I've ever tasted.
I'll have to try it sometime. I also really like spicy Thai food.
Thai food is great too. I love Pad Thai and Green Curry.
We should go out for a meal together sometime and try a new restaurant.
That sounds like a plan! Let's do it next weekend.

title: Reported Speech (Final Review)
notes: Reported Speech မှာ Statements, Questions, Requests နဲ့ Commands တွေအားလုံးကို ကျွမ်းကျင်အောင် ပြန်လည်လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: He said he would be there on time.
examples.my: သူ အချိန်မှန် ရောက်လာမယ်လို့ ပြောခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: She asked me what I was doing.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော် ဘာလုပ်နေလဲလို့ သူမက မေးခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: They told us to wait in the lobby.

quiz.q: She said she ___ (not / see) him for ages.
He asked if I ___ (can / help) him.

lines.text: Excuse me, I've just arrived on the flight from London and my suitcase is missing.
I'm sorry to hear that. Can I see your baggage claim tag, please?
Yes, here it is.
Thank you. Let me check the system... It seems your bag was delayed and is still in London.
Oh no! When will it arrive?
It should be on the next flight, which arrives tomorrow morning at 10 AM.
Can you deliver it to my hotel?
Yes, of course. Please provide your hotel address and a contact number.

title: Conditionals (Final Review)
notes: Conditionals တွေကို အခြေအနေအမျိုးမျိုးမှာ ကျွမ်းကျင်စွာ အသုံးပြုနိုင်အောင် နောက်ဆုံးအကြိမ် ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: If I had more time, I'd learn another language.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော့်မှာ အချိန်ပိုရှိရင် နောက်ထပ် ဘာသာစကားတစ်ခု သင်ယူမှာပါ။

examples.en: If she had known the truth, she would have been very upset.
examples.my: သူမသာ အမှန်တရားကို သိခဲ့ရင် အရမ်း စိတ်မကောင်း ဖြစ်မှာပဲ။

examples.en: I'll call you if I need any help.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော် အကူအညီ လိုရင် မင်းဆီ ဖုန်းဆက်ပါ့မယ်။

quiz.q: If I ___ (be) you, I would take the job.
If we ___ (leave) earlier, we wouldn't have missed the bus.

lines.text: We need to rethink our marketing strategy for the upcoming year.
I agree. Our current approach isn't reaching our target audience effectively.
What do you suggest we do differently?
I think we should focus more on social media influencers and targeted online ads.
That's a good point. We should also look into expanding our presence in international markets.
Exactly. There's a lot of potential growth in the Southeast Asian region.
Let's put together a proposal and present it to the board next week.
I'll start working on the market research and the budget estimates.

title: Phrasal Verbs (Final Review)
notes: Phrasal Verbs အမျိုးမျိုးကို နေ့စဉ်စကားပြောတွေမှာ ပိုမိုသဘာဝကျကျ သုံးနိုင်အောင် ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: I need to find out what's going on.
examples.my: ဘာတွေဖြစ်နေလဲဆိုတာ ကျွန်တော် သိဖို့ လိုပါတယ်။

examples.en: Don't give up on your dreams.
examples.my: မင်းရဲ့ အိမ်မက်တွေကို လက်မလျှော့လိုက်ပါနဲ့။

examples.en: She looks after her younger brother.
examples.my: သူမဟာ သူမရဲ့ ညီလေးကို စောင့်ရှောက်ပါတယ်။

quiz.q: The meeting was ___ (put) until next week.

lines.text: Are you doing anything exciting this weekend?
I'm thinking about going on a short trip to the mountains.
That sounds like a great idea. Are you going alone or with friends?
A few friends are coming with me. We're planning to do some hiking.
Where are you going to stay? A hotel or a cabin?
We've booked a small cabin near a lake. It should be very peaceful.
I'm so jealous! I hope you have a wonderful time.
Thank you. I'll make sure to take plenty of photos to show you!

title: Modal Verbs (Final Review)
notes: Modal Verbs တွေကို စွမ်းဆောင်နိုင်ရည်၊ ခွင့်တောင်းခြင်း၊ အကြံပေးခြင်းနဲ့ ဖြစ်နိုင်ခြေတွေအတွက် ကျွမ်းကျင်စွာ အသုံးပြုနိုင်အောင် နောက်ဆုံးအကြိမ် ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: I can speak three languages fluently.
You should definitely visit the museum while you're here.
examples.my: မင်း ဒီမှာ ရှိနေတုန်းမှာ ပြတိုက်ကို သွားကြည့်သင့်တယ်။

examples.en: It might be cold later, so bring a jacket.
examples.my: နောက်မှ အေးလာနိုင်လို့ ဂျာကင်ယူလာပါ။

quiz.q: I ___ (be) able to come to the meeting tomorrow.

lines.text: How do you manage to stay so fit and healthy?
I try to exercise at least four times a week and I eat a balanced diet.
What kind of exercise do you usually do?
I enjoy running, swimming, and I also do some yoga at home.
That's a lot of variety. I find it hard to motivate myself to exercise.
The key is to find something you truly enjoy. Then it won't feel like work.
I'll have to keep trying different things until I find what works for me.
Exactly. Just don't give up. Your health is your most valuable asset.

title: Progress Exam 18
explanation: ယခင်သင်ခန်းစာများမှ သဒ္ဒါနှင့် စကားပြောများကို ပြန်လည်စစ်ဆေးခြင်း။

lines.text: The new building was designed by a world-famous architect.
I have been learning how to play the acoustic guitar for five years.
She said that she had already finished her work.
If I had known about the meeting, I would have attended.
The suspect is currently being questioned by the police.
I wish I had more free time to explore the city.
I'm looking forward to our family reunion next month.
My suitcase was delayed and is still at the airport in London.
You must be exhausted after your long journey.
Congratulations on your successful business strategy presentation!

title: Relative Clauses (Mixed Review)
notes: Relative Clauses တွေအားလုံးကို ဝါကျအမျိုးမျိုးမှာ ကျွမ်းကျင်စွာ အသုံးချနိုင်အောင် ပြန်လည်လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: The book that I'm reading is really good.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော် အခုဖတ်နေတဲ့စာအုပ်က အရမ်းကောင်းတယ်။

examples.en: Do you know the boy who is talking to Sarah?
examples.my: စာရာနဲ့ စကားပြောနေတဲ့ ကောင်လေးကို မင်း သိသလား။

examples.en: The restaurant where we had dinner was excellent.
examples.my: ငါတို့ ညစာစားခဲ့တဲ့ စားသောက်ဆိုင်က အရမ်းကောင်းတယ်။

quiz.q: I have a friend ___ (work) in a bank.
The city ___ (I live) is very busy.

lines.text: What do you think the main theme of the movie was?
I think it was about the importance of family and staying true to yourself.
That's an interesting perspective. I thought it was more about the consequences of greed.
Well, there were certainly elements of that too. The main character's choices were driven by ambition.
Exactly. And his downfall was quite tragic because of it.
It definitely makes you think about what really matters in life.
That's the mark of a great movie—one that leaves you with something to reflect on.
I totally agree. I'll be thinking about this one for a while.

title: Conditionals (Advanced Review 2)
notes: Conditionals တွေကို ပိုမိုရှုပ်ထွေးတဲ့ ဝါကျတွေမှာ ဘယ်လိုမှန်မှန်ကန်ကန် သုံးနှုန်းမလဲဆိုတာကို ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: If I had known, I would have told you.
If she were here, she would know what to do.
examples.my: သူမသာ ဒီမှာရှိရင် ဘာလုပ်ရမလဲဆိုတာ သိမှာပဲ။

examples.en: If you study hard, you will pass the exam.

quiz.q: If I ___ (be) a bird, I would fly.
If we ___ (leave) now, we will be on time.

lines.text: We should organize a neighborhood cleanup day this spring.
That's a fantastic idea! It would really bring the community together.
We could focus on the local park and the surrounding streets.
We'll need to get permission from the city and recruit some volunteers.
I can post an announcement on our neighborhood social media page.
And I'll talk to some of our neighbors directly to see if they're interested.
Great. Let's aim for the last Saturday of April.
Sounds like a plan. It'll be a lot of work, but it'll be worth it.

title: Reported Speech (Advanced Review 2)
notes: Reported Speech မှာ ပိုမိုရှုပ်ထွေးတဲ့ ဝါကျတွေကို ဘယ်လိုပြောင်းလဲမလဲဆိုတာ နောက်ဆုံးအကြိမ် လေ့ကျင့်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: He told me that he had already seen the movie.
She asked me if I would be able to help her.
examples.my: သူမကို ကျွန်တော် ကူညီနိုင်မလားလို့ သူမက မေးခဲ့တယ်။

examples.en: They said they were planning to travel next year.
examples.my: သူတို့ နောက်နှစ်မှာ ခရီးသွားဖို့ စီစဉ်နေတယ်လို့ ပြောခဲ့တယ်။

lines.text: We've reviewed the proposed contract, but we have some concerns regarding the termination clause.
I understand. What specific changes would you like to see?
We'd like to extend the notice period from 30 days to 60 days.
That seems reasonable. Are there any other points you'd like to discuss?
Yes, we'd also like to clarify the payment terms for the initial phase.
Okay. Let's go through the budget together and see if we can reach an agreement.
I believe we're very close to a final deal. Let's aim to sign by Friday.
I agree. I'll have the updated contract sent over to you this afternoon.

title: Passive Voice (Advanced Review 2)
notes: Passive Voice ကို ပိုမိုရှုပ်ထွေးတဲ့ ဝါကျတွေနဲ့ အသုံးအနှုန်းတွေမှာ ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: The house is being painted by professional decorators.
examples.my: အိမ်ကို ကျွမ်းကျင်ပညာရှင်တွေက ဆေးသုတ်နေကြတယ်။

examples.en: The decision was made after a long discussion.
The results will be announced tomorrow morning.
examples.my: ရလဒ်တွေကို မနက်ဖြန်မနက်မှာ ကြေညာပါလိမ့်မယ်။

quiz.q: All the tasks ___ (finish) by next week.

lines.text: If you could do anything in the world, what would your dream job be?
I've always dreamed of being a travel writer and exploring remote parts of the globe.
That sounds like an amazing adventure! What's stopping you?
I guess I just need to build up my portfolio and find the right opportunities.
You're a very talented writer. I'm sure you could make it happen if you really set your mind to it.
Thank you. I'm going to start a travel blog this year to get some experience.
That's a great first step! I'll be your first subscriber.
I appreciate the support. It's time to start making my dreams a reality!

title: Modal Verbs (Advanced Review 2)
notes: Modal Verbs တွေကို ပိုမိုရှုပ်ထွေးတဲ့ အခြေအနေတွေမှာ ဘယ်လိုမှန်မှန်ကန်ကန် သုံးနှုန်းမလဲဆိုတာကို ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: I can speak three languages fluently.
You should definitely visit the museum while you're here.
examples.my: မင်း ဒီမှာ ရှိနေတုန်းမှာ ပြတိုက်ကို သွားကြည့်သင့်တယ်။

examples.en: It might be cold later, so bring a jacket.
examples.my: နောက်မှ အေးလာနိုင်လို့ ဂျာကင်ယူလာပါ။

quiz.q: I ___ (be) able to come to the meeting tomorrow.

lines.text: I've been going through a bit of a difficult time lately, but I'm trying to stay positive.
I'm sorry to hear that. Is there anything I can do to help?
Just talking about it helps. I've been feeling quite overwhelmed with work and personal issues.
It's important to take things one day at a time. Don't be too hard on yourself.
I know. I've been trying to practice some mindfulness and self-care.
That's a good approach. Remember that it's okay to ask for help when you need it.
Thank you. I really appreciate your support and understanding.
Of course. We all go through tough times. You're not alone.

title: Progress Exam 19
explanation: ယခင်သင်ခန်းစာများမှ သဒ္ဒါနှင့် စကားပြောများကို ပြန်လည်စစ်ဆေးခြင်း။

lines.text: The house that they bought is very spacious and modern.
If I had more time, I would learn how to play the violin.
She said she had already finished her work before the deadline.
The suspect is being questioned by the detectives right now.
You must be very proud of your recent achievements.
I wish I could travel around the world someday.
We're planning to organize a neighborhood cleanup day.
I'd like to extend the notice period in the contract.
It's important to take things one day at a time.
Congratulations on starting your own travel blog!

title: Phrasal Verbs (Review - Travel and Arrival)
notes:
ခရီးသွားလာမှုနဲ့ ရောက်ရှိမှုဆိုင်ရာ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

- Check in, check out, take off, set off, get in, get off.

examples.en: We checked into the hotel at 2 PM.
What time does your flight take off?
examples.my: မင်းရဲ့ လေယာဉ် ဘယ်အချိန်မှာ ပျံတက်မှာလဲ။

examples.en: We set off early to avoid the traffic.

quiz.q: We need to ___ (check) of the hotel by noon.
The plane ___ (take) half an hour late.

lines.text: Good morning. I'd like to check out of room 305, please.
Certainly. Did you enjoy your stay with us?
Yes, it was very comfortable. The staff were very helpful.
I'm glad to hear that. Here is your final bill. Would you like to review it?
Everything looks correct. I'll pay by credit card.
Okay. Please insert your card here... Thank you. Your receipt is in the folder.
Thank you. Can you help me call a taxi to the airport?
Of course. One will be here in about five minutes. Safe travels!

title: Phrasal Verbs (Review - Work and Business)
notes:
အလုပ်ခွင်နဲ့ စီးပွားရေးဆိုင်ရာ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

- Fill in, hand in, call off, put off, take over, work out.

examples.en: I'll fill in for you while you're on vacation.
examples.my: မင်း အားလပ်ရက်ယူနေတုန်း မင်းအစား ငါဝင်လုပ်ပေးမယ်။

examples.en: The manager decided to take over the project.
examples.my: မန်နေဂျာက စီမံကိန်းကို လွှဲပြောင်းရယူဖို့ ဆုံးဖြတ်လိုက်တယ်။

examples.en: We need to work out a new schedule.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော်တို့ အချိန်ဇယားအသစ်တစ်ခုကို တွက်ချက်ဖော်ထုတ်ဖို့ လိုပါတယ်။

lines.text: Hi, I'm back to finalize opening my savings account.
Welcome back. I see you have all the necessary documents now.
Yes, I have my ID and the proof of address you requested.
Excellent. We'll just need you to sign a few more forms.
Is the debit card mailed to me or do I pick it up here?
It will be mailed to your home address within five business days.
Okay. And how do I set up online banking?
I can help you with that right now. It only takes a few minutes.

title: Phrasal Verbs (Review - Social and Personal)
notes:
လူမှုရေးနဲ့ ပုဂ္ဂိုလ်ရေးဆိုင်ရာ Phrasal Verbs တွေကို နောက်ဆုံးအကြိမ် ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

- Get along, hang out, go out, look after, look for, get over.

examples.en: It took him a long time to get over the breakup.
examples.my: လမ်းခွဲရတာကို ပြန်လည်သက်သာဖို့ သူ့မှာ အချိန်အကြာကြီး ယူခဲ့ရတယ်။

examples.en: She looks after her elderly parents.
examples.my: သူမဟာ သူမရဲ့ အသက်ကြီးတဲ့ မိဘတွေကို ပြုစုစောင့်ရှောက်ပါတယ်။

examples.en: We're going out for a walk in the park.
examples.my: ကျွန်တော်တို့ ပန်းခြံထဲမှာ လမ်းလျှောက်ဖို့ အပြင်ထွက်ကြမယ်။

lines.text: Hi, I'm Adrian. I noticed you're also taking the photography class.
Hi Adrian, I'm Sarah. Yes, I've always wanted to improve my skills.
Me too. What kind of camera do you use?
I have a mirrorless Sony. It's quite compact and easy to carry around.
That's a great choice. I'm using a Canon DSLR.
Nice! Maybe we can go on a photo walk together sometime.
I'd love that! There are some beautiful spots by the river.
Perfect. Let's exchange numbers and plan something for next weekend.

title: Prepositions Review (Final)
notes: ဝိဘတ် (Prepositions) အားလုံးကို ခြုံငုံပြီး နောက်ဆုံးအကြိမ် ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: The meeting is at 10 AM on Monday in the conference room.
examples.my: အစည်းအဝေးက တနင်္လာနေ့ မနက် ၁၀ နာရီမှာ အစည်းအဝေးခန်းမထဲမှာ ရှိပါတယ်။

examples.en: We walked across the bridge and along the river bank.
I'm interested in learning more about your culture.

lines.text: Excuse me, I'm trying to find the historical museum. Could you help me?
Certainly. It's a bit of a walk from here. You need to go straight for three blocks.
Three blocks straight, okay. And then?
Then turn right at the big intersection with the traffic lights.
Right at the intersection. Is it visible from there?
Not quite. You'll need to go past the library and then turn left into a small alleyway.
Past the library and then left into the alley. That sounds a bit complicated!
It can be tricky. But once you're in the alley, the museum will be right in front of you.

title: Articles Review (Final)
notes: Articles (A, An, The) အသုံးအနှုန်းတွေကို နောက်ဆုံးအကြိမ် ပြန်လည်သုံးသပ်ပါမယ်။

examples.en: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.
examples.my: နေဟာ အရှေ့ဘက်က ထွက်ပြီး အနောက်ဘက်မှာ ဝင်ပါတယ်။

examples.en: I need an umbrella because it's starting to rain.
examples.my: မိုးရွာနေလို့ ကျွန်တော့်မှာ ထီးတစ်လက် လိုအပ်ပါတယ်။

examples.en: He is the most talented musician I know.
examples.my: သူဟာ ကျွန်တော်သိသမျှထဲမှာ အရည်အချင်းအရှိဆုံး ဂီတပညာရှင် တစ်ယောက်ပါ။

lines.text: So, Adrian, how has your daily routine changed lately?
I've been trying to wake up earlier and do some meditation before starting my work.
That sounds very peaceful. Does it help you stay focused during the day?
Definitely. I feel much more grounded and less stressed.
I should try incorporating that into my routine too. I'm usually so rushed in the morning.
Start small, even just five or ten minutes can make a difference.
I'll give it a go starting tomorrow. Thanks for the advice!
You're welcome. Good luck with your new morning habit!

title: Final Graduation Exam
explanation: သင်ခန်းစာအားလုံးမှ သဒ္ဒါနှင့် စကားပြောများကို အလုံးစုံ ပြန်လည်စစ်ဆေးခြင်း။

lines.text: The bridge is being repaired after the recent storm.
If I had taken your advice, I would be much happier now.
She told me that she had already finished the report.
I wish I could travel around the world someday.
The man whose car was stolen is very upset today.
Let's have a break and get some coffee, shall we?
I am not used to waking up so early in the morning.
Could you please tell me where the nearest bank is?
He has been learning English for over three years now.
Congratulations on the successful completion of the course!
